intro: Hypericum thymopsis, commonly known as small-stemmed St. John's wort, is a perennial shrub native to southern Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring compact, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers with four petals, blooming from June to August. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy surface. Hypericum thymopsis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to full sun conditions.
